abstract.p: Pall is been cast over Olympic women's marathon trials later this month in Columbia, SC, because of controversy over presence of Confederate flag, which flies over South Carolina Capitol (S)

block.p: A pall has been cast over the Olympic women's marathon trials later this month in Columbia, S.C. The presence of the Confederate flag, which flies over the South Carolina Capitol, has forced track to enter the politics of race.

In a statement released yesterday, USA Track and Field, which chose Columbia as the marathon site two years ago, urged the South Carolina Legislature to remove the flag from its Statehouse as soon as possible.

A pall has been cast over the Olympic women's marathon trials later this month in Columbia, S.C. The presence of the Confederate flag, which flies over the South Carolina Capitol, has forced track to enter the politics of race.

In a statement released yesterday, USA Track and Field, which chose Columbia as the marathon site two years ago, urged the South Carolina Legislature to remove the flag from its Statehouse as soon as possible.

''U.S.A.T.F. is the governing body for a sport that includes among its participants athletes from all ethnic and socioeconomic backgrounds,'' the statement said. For many Americans, the Confederate flag is a symbol of subjugation and segregation.

Craig Masback, the chief executive of the association, said it had received inquiries from individual athletes who were concerned about the issue and felt it was appropriate for USA Track and Field to make a statement.
